messageBody:
Chad Woolley wrote:

> Hi,
>
> In a project I am working on, the current test suite is modeled on the
> code from
> this JavaWorld article:
>
> http://www.javaworld.com/javaworld/jw-12-2000/jw-1221-junit-p4.html
>
> P.S. I know I could probably modify the existing code to do this, but I'm
> looking for something simpler, which would also preferably handle the
> directory
> recursing and test-finding rather than having to hardcode all that logic.

JUnit-addons DirectorySuiteBuilder handles the recursive directory
structure. As for finding tests, you just have to write the right filter.

I don't recommend collecting tests from inside the test case classes --
we went over this in detail a few months ago. There is one possibility:
XDoclet. I don't know much about it from a practical perspective, but it
seems to make that you could use XDoclet and "test category" tags to
generate test suite collecting code. A test or test suite could belong
to multiple categories.

If anyone has done any work in this direction, it'd be good to know.
